intro: Oreopanax striatus, commonly known as the zigzag sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinctive zigzag pattern along the midrib. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by elliptical berries that turn red when mature. Oreopanax striatus thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
